update.description:
In this PR I address [[CLOUD-75]](https://osrfoundation.atlassian.net/browse/CLOUD-75).

A dropdown element was created to list Amazon Regions, in order to avoid duplicated code between the fields of the Simulator and Field Computer. It starts blank by default.

A warning is fired if the user wants to continue without completing all the fields from either Simulator or Field Computer. The GitHub repository and Team Name are already being checked. Should the Github Deploy Key be checked as well? So far it does not fires a warning.

ptal @chapulina
fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshots:

Normal view.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902447473.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/4160349592-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902447473.png)

Opening a dropdown.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902467462.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/2865584985-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902467462.png)

Warning on Simulator's empty fields.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902524141.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1348726070-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902524141.png)

Warning on Field Computer's empty fields.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902541044.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/1220771827-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902541044.png)
update.title: Amazon Region Dropdown

content.raw: Thank you! I changed it now.

content.raw: Default seems like a more appropriate keyword than empty.

content.raw:
I addressed the comment about being able to deselect the region. An empty item didn't looked good, so I included one with an "Empty" label, which deselects the dropdown's option. ptal @chapulina

Dropdown List:

content.raw: Thanks, this works for me. I just have one final comment and this should be good to go.
content.html: Thanks, this works for me. I just have one final comment and this should be good to go.

content.raw: Can we add an empty option? After I choose a region by mistake, there was no way to deselect it to use the default instead.
content.html: Can we add an empty option? After I choose a region by mistake, there was no way to deselect it to use the default instead.

content.raw:
I addressed the comments. Now the three empty fields won't fire a warning. It is fired only when some fields are filled, but not the three of them.

I also moved the element to keep them sorted alphabetically.

ptal again @chapulina

A screenshot for the change:
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493923780974.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/389645341-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493923780974.png)
content.html:
I addressed the comments. Now the three empty fields won't fire a warning. It is fired only when some fields are filled, but not the three of them.

I also moved the element to keep them sorted alphabetically.

ptal again @chapulina

A screenshot for the change:

A dropdown element was created to list Amazon Regions, in order to avoid duplicated code between the fields of the Simulator and Field Computer. It starts blank by default.

A warning is fired if the user wants to continue without completing all the fields from either Simulator or Field Computer. The GitHub repository and Team Name are already being checked. Should the Github Deploy Key be checked as well? So far it does not fires a warning.

ptal @chapulina
fyi @andres_fortier

Screenshots:

Normal view.
![screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902447473.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/oyRq5d/images/4160349592-screencapture-localhost-8080-src-1493902447473.png)

update.title: Amazon Region Dropdown

content.raw: Yup, I think the message you're suggesting is good :)
content.html: Yup, I think the message you're suggesting is good :)

content.raw:
Thanks for the clarification! I didn't know that cloudsim-portal used default values if these were empty. That's good!

Do you think the user would want to know about this? Should we explicitly tell them that they can leave all the fields empty, in order to use the default values? We could say in the warning: "Please fill all the fields for the machine to work, or leave them all empty to use default values".

Otherwise, the warning should instruct them to fill all the fields, only if any of them is filled.
content.html:
Thanks for the clarification! I didn't know that cloudsim-portal used default values if these were empty. That's good!

Do you think the user would want to know about this? Should we explicitly tell them that they can leave all the fields empty, in order to use the default values? We could say in the warning: "Please fill all the fields for the machine to work, or leave them all empty to use default values".

Otherwise, the warning should instruct them to fill all the fields, only if any of them is filled.

content.raw: Hi @german-mas, thanks for the PR! This is going in the right direction, I just have a few minor comments before we can merge it :smile:
content.html: Hi @german-mas, thanks for the PR! This is going in the right direction, I just have a few minor comments before we can merge it

content.raw:
Actually, filling these fields is optional. If the machine information is left empty, cloudsim-portal will use default (or "official") values.

I think a more appropriate check would be to:

1. See if any of the 3 fields for a machine are filled
1. If any of them are, but not one of the other 2, then let the user know that they must fill all 3 for the machine to work
1. If they are all empty, we don't trigger a warning because it's ok to leave the whole information empty

What do you think?
content.html:
Actually, filling these fields is optional. If the machine information is left empty, cloudsim-portal will use default (or "official") values.

I think a more appropriate check would be to:

  1. See if any of the 3 fields for a machine are filled
  2. If any of them are, but not one of the other 2, then let the user know that they must fill all 3 for the machine to work
  3. If they are all empty, we don't trigger a warning because it's ok to leave the whole information empty

What do you think?

content.raw: Thank you for pointing it out! I didn't noticed they were in order. I'll take it into account for future ones.
content.html: Thank you for pointing it out! I didn't noticed they were in order. I'll take it into account for future ones.

content.raw: Nitpick: do you ming placing this in alphabetical order?
content.html: Nitpick: do you ming placing this in alphabetical order?

content.raw:
> Should the Github Deploy Key be checked as well? So far it does not fires a warning.

It's ok to leave that field blank when using public repos
content.html:
Should the Github Deploy Key be checked as well? So far it does not fires a warning.

It's ok to leave that field blank when using public repos
